channel.title: Website / Servers down
channel.description:
Hello,
Servers and website were down several hours before I wrote this after, update was happened broken same. Are we cool?

item.title: Website / Servers down
item.dc:creator: fortasse
item.description:
This was actually a downtime that our datacenter caused. It was outside our control, and as far as I know, unrelated to DDoS. It was just a configuration mistake.

Read full topic

item.title: Website / Servers down
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
I’d assume Whonix is a semi-popular DDOS attack target for spooks paid by your tax dollars to frustrate people trying to uphold their inalienable right to privacy. See:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denial-of-service_attack

Note that onion services are not immune either, which is why when whonix.org is non-responsive, so is kkkkkkkkkk63ava6.onion usually. See:

https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/24298

This seems to happen every few weeks. If it is a server-based issue, I’m sure @fortasse would know about it.

Read full topic
